fields.value: Uniform Crime Reports, 1958-1969, and County and City Data Books, 1962, 1967, 1972:  Merged Data

authorName.value: United States Department of Commerce. Bureau of the Census

authorAffiliation.value: United States Department of Commerce. Bureau of the Census

dsDescriptionValue.value: This dataset includes selected variables and cases from the  Federal Bureau of Investigation's Uniform Crime Reports, 1958-1969,  and the County and City Data Books for 1962, 1967, and 1972. Data are  reported for all United States cities with a population of 75,000 or  more in 1960. Data from the Uniform Crime Reports include for each year  the number of homicides, forcible rapes, robberies, aggravated assaults,  burglaries, larcenies over 50 dollars, and auto thefts. Also included is the  Total Crime Index, which is the simple sum of all the crimes listed  above. Selected variables describing population characteristics and  city finances were taken from the 1962, 1967, and 1972 County and City Data Books.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR XVII.E. Social Institutions and Behavior, Crime and the Criminal Justice System
